oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Colonel Samuel Lockett
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Samuel Henry Lockett in uniform wearing lieutenant colonel insignia.

Samuel Henry Lockett was a Confederate Engineer responsible for the defenses of Vicksburg. He later taught math and science at Louisiana State University and the University of Tennessee at Knoxville. He also served as an engineer in the Egyptian Army and was involved in the construction of the Statue of Liberty.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Washburn
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Men; Engineers; Military Officers
